fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
Autodesk has been following closely the following EU initiatives, policies and legislative files during 2017: 
       Launch of the Digital Skill and Jobs Coalition on Dec. 1, 2016; 
•    Directive 2002/91/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 December 2002 on the energy performance of buildings 
•    Directive 2009/125/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 October 2009 establishing a framework for the setting of ecodesign requirements for energy-related products 
•    Directive 2012/27/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 October 2012 on energy efficiency (General Directive and Principles)  
•    Public Consultation on the Circular Economy (Aug. 20, 2015 submission)  
•    Directive 2014/24EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 February 2014 on public procurement
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

goals__remit:
Autodesk is a leader in 3D design, engineering, construction, manufacturing and entertainment software, developing a broad portfolio of 3D software for global markets.  Customers across the manufacturing, architecture, engineering, building, construction, and media and entertainment industries use Autodesk software to design and make almost anything.   
http://www.autodesk.com/company 
 
Autodesk acquired Delcam Ltd. (Delcam), one of the world’s leading suppliers of advanced computer-aided manufacturing (CAM) software, in February 2014. With the exception of certain non-material legacy Delcam subsidiaries and joint ventures, since August 2016 Delcam has been integrated as an Autodesk entity and its activities therefore are reported as Autodesk’s in this report for the purpose of transparency. See  http://www.delcam.co.uk
relevant_communication:
]   Autodesk participates, at the European Commission’s invitation, in events organized by the Directorate General for Communications Networks, Content and Technology (DG CNECT) and the Directorate General for Research and Innovation (DG RTD).  Autodesk also supports Commission efforts as a member of the European Factories of the Future Research Association (EFFRA) and through its active involvement in Innovate UK, and participates in related collaborative projects (e.g., SYMPLEXITY, HyProCell and LASIMM).  The following is a partial list of associations/federations or other types of networks to which Autodesk belonged in FY 2017: 
  
•    European Factories of the Future Research Association (EFFRA) – www.effra.eu 
•    Gauge and Tool Makers Association (GTMA) – www.gtma.co.uk 
•    Innovate UK – www.gov.uk/government/organisations/innovate-uk 
•    The Aerospace technology Institute (ATI) - http://www.ati.org.uk/   
•    The Manufacturing Technology Centre (MTC) - http://www.the-mtc.org/  
•    Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre (AMRC) - http://www.amrc.co.uk/  
•    The Nuclear Manufacturing Research Centre (NMRC) - http://namrc.co.uk/
